image.altText: A fish hanging from a hook in it's mouth. River and green grassy banks in background.

props.synopsis: Commercial fishing boats can continue allowed to deploy thousands of metres of fishing nets in the Roper and Daly river systems under a short-term plan.

title.children: Commercial fishing boats to continue use of gillnets in popular NT rivers

image.altText: Grainy footage shows a man in a suit lying on the ground, one hand to his ear holding a phone.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says the opposition frontbencher owes the public an explanation for why he was laid out on a footpath in Canberra's entertainment district late after a parliament sitting day, with Peter Dutton revealing he'll speak to the 56-year-old about the incident.

title.children: PM says Joyce must explain himself after former deputy leader filmed lying on footpath

image.altText: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton speaks to the media at a press conference

props.synopsis: The Coalition will unwind laws allowing workers to ignore unreasonable out-of-hours contact from their bosses, the Opposition Leader says, committing his party to undoing the 'right to disconnect' if it wins the next federal election.

title.children: Peter Dutton says Coalition will repeal 'right to disconnect' laws if it wins government

image.altText: Donald Trump points his index fingers up as he speaks into a microphone with an animated expression

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says that, as president, he warned NATO allies that he "would encourage" Russia "to do whatever the hell they want" to countries that are "delinquent" as he ramped up his attacks on foreign aid and longstanding international alliances.

title.children: Donald Trump says he warned NATO ally: Spend more on defence or Russia can 'do whatever the hell they want'

image.altText: Taylor Swift dressed in a blue dress looks over her shoulder while standing in front of a sign saying Taylor Swift Eras Tour

props.synopsis: Taylor Swift is at the centre of a far-right conspiracy theory that claims the singer is part of an elaborate plot to rig football games and deliver Joe Biden the presidency. Here's how it unfolded.

title.children: Why far-right figures will be particularly concerned by Taylor Swift at the Super Bowl ahead of 2024 election

image.altText: A composite of a  tree-lined dirt track extending away into the bush, and a thin smiling woman with blonde hair.

props.synopsis: A vigil has been held for Samantha Murphy in her home town of Ballarat as the investigation into the disappearance of the 51-year-old woman enters its second week.

title.children: Vigil held for missing woman Samantha Murphy as PM extends sympathies

image.altText: Annastacia Palaszczuk sits in a chair, looking directly into camera with a serious facial expression.

props.synopsis: It was the first time Annastacia Palaszczuk had ever hung up on a prime minister, and an episode the former Queensland premier says might provide insight into how Scott Morrison relates to women.

title.children: Did Scott Morrison have a problem with women? Ex-Qld premier says a call she had with him may provide insight

image.altText: A Manly rugby league players stands holding an award.

props.synopsis: Experts say Manly Sea Eagles player Keith Titmuss died from an illness that is "massively underestimated".

title.children: 'Under-reported': The deadly illness affecting young, healthy Australians

image.altText: A snapping turtle with a spiky shell is laid out on a towel, opening its mouth wide open.

props.synopsis: The dinosaur-looking creature, native to the US south, was spotted bathing in a lake in Cumbria by a local dog walker.

title.children: Woman fishes alligator snapping turtle out of English lake using a shopping basket

image.altText: Victoria ambulance paramedic badge on the sleeve of an officer's shirt

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to the Murray River in Moama after reports a man had been seriously injured in the Southern 80 waterski race.

title.children: Man dies in waterskiing event on Victorian–NSW border

image.altText: a surfer on a massive wave with his partner in the foreground sitting in a little tender boat

props.synopsis: Torren Martyn and his partner Aiyana Powell barely knew how to sail before embarking on 12-month voyage through the tropics. On their little boat Calypte, the couple braved wild weather, survived a brush with death and scored some of the best waves of their lives.

title.children: With no sailing experience, an Aussie surfer set off on a 9,000km adventure and had the trip of a lifetime

image.altText: A hand holding a glass of water with a small round white tabled on the palm of the opposite hand.

props.synopsis: Antidepressant "blockbusters" are prescribed to one in seven of us in Australia, among the highest rates in the world. Yet rates continue to rise. The evidence suggests they're over-prescribed. So how did we get here?

title.children: Why are so many Australians taking antidepressants?

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: Oh, you're back? Something to prove after last week's effort? Let's see what you've got.

title.children: So, you think you're good at quizzes? It's time to play HARD!

image.altText: Red and silver striped beer keg sits in front of old wooden wine barrels

props.synopsis: Kegs are being stolen in their hundreds every week from brewers, pubs and bars, costing independent businesses dearly. Thieves are operating in the dead of night and in some cases removing tracking devices from kegs, leading to speculation over who is responsible.

title.children: This brewery has tracking devices on its kegs — and some are turning up in places they shouldn't

image.altText: A middle-aged man stands on the beach holding a bucket and rubbish tongs.

props.synopsis: Andy Orr did not dive into a life of luxury when he received an inheritance but instead dedicated his time to cleaning up the beaches of Sydney Harbour.

title.children: Inheritance allows 'Guardian of Sydney Harbour' to quit his job and pick up plastic

image.altText: A woman in scrubs walking down a hallway with her hands on her head

props.synopsis: Hospitals have become a strange new battleground in the fight against COVID, with doctors and public health experts concerned that too many patients are catching the virus — and an alarming number are dying — as a result of inadequate infection control.

title.children: 'Robodebt of medicine': Patients are catching COVID and dying in hospitals, doctors say

image.altText: Greenish-yellow glass fruits glow on a blue table in a dark room

props.synopsis: The Art Gallery of WA has meticulously curated thousands of pieces of delicate glass created by a First Nations artist to tell significant stories.

title.children: Luminous glass artworks bring troubling histories into the light

image.altText: Bright red and blue lights flash on a wet roadsdie where two SES trucks are parked with emergency workers on the road

props.synopsis: Two men and a woman have died in a head-on collision at Armidale in northern New South Wales. Another woman is in a critical condition, while a two-year-old boy in under observation in hospital.

title.children: Head-on highway crash kills three people, leaves fourth fighting for her life

image.altText: Molly Picklum gives shakas to the camera while on a surfboard in the ocean. She is wearing a Red Bull helmet.

props.synopsis: Molly Picklum loses the final of the Pipe Pro in Hawaii, but cements her place in history with the first perfect ride by a woman at the famous surf break.

title.children: 'Absolutely insane': Aussie surfer Molly Picklum makes history with first women's perfect 10 at Pipeline event

image.altText: Lauren Jackson smiles

props.synopsis: Lauren Jackson reveals she will not play in the Olympic Games later this year just after the Opals beat Germany to qualify for Paris.

title.children: Opals qualify for Paris Olympics but Lauren Jackson says she won't be there

image.altText: A man rummages through building debris.

props.synopsis: Key mediators in the Gaza conflict are warning of repercussions if Israel launches a ground invasion in Rafah as 44 Palestinians are reported dead in air strikes.

title.children: Israeli air strikes kill 44 in Rafah amid plans for potential ground invasion

image.altText: A close of the Scream with white newspaper text overlaid reading "the scream is back but where was it"

props.synopsis: A robber's thank you card, a lengthy sting operation and a professional footballer turned art thief — here's how the theft of Edvard Munch's The Scream captivated the world.

title.children: Two men, one ladder, and 50 seconds — that's all it took to steal one of the most famous paintings in history

image.altText: A young white woman with chin-length red hair wearing black stands side on against a backdrop of green leafy plants

props.synopsis: Does the sad girl novel map the emotional landscape of a generation or the malaise of the privileged classes?

title.children: From Lana Del Rey to Sally Rooney, why are millennial women so miserable?

image.altText: The back of a woman's head looking at a laptop screen on a table.

props.synopsis: Abigail* says her ex-husband used his technology skills to control and monitor both in and out of their relationship. Experts say common apps are being misused to stalk victims of domestic violence.

title.children: When Abigail's ex sent emails detailing what she had said in therapy, it gave her goosebumps

image.altText: firefighters standing outside an Ice Arena building.

props.synopsis: SA Health says more than 20 people went to the Royal Adelaide Hospital early this morning after attending the Ice Arena in Adelaide's inner west yesterday.

title.children: Suspected carbon monoxide leak at Adelaide Ice Arena sees more than 20 people attend hospital

image.altText: A smiling King Charles looks over his shoulder while dressed in a suit.

props.synopsis: King Charles expresses his heartfelt thanks for the messages of support in his first personal statement on his cancer diagnosis.

title.children: King shares thanks for messages of support after cancer diagnosis

image.altText: A middle-aged woman with dark hair speaks at a podium with Hungarian flags behind her.

props.synopsis: Katalin Novak, a close ally of Prime Minister Viktor Orbán, resigns after coming under mounting pressure for pardoning a man convicted of helping to cover up sexual abuse in a children's home.

title.children: Hungarian president resigns over pardon for convicted child abuse accomplice

image.altText: A profile shot of the bishop next to a church logo on a car

props.synopsis: Australian priests say they have faith Pope Francis and other leaders in the Catholic Church to act decisively on allegations against the former Bishop of Broome Christopher Saunders.

title.children: Pressure grows for Vatican decision on Australian bishop who has denied sexual abuse allegations
